extendedIngredients.name: rice chex
extendedIngredients.originalString: 9 cups Rice Chex cereal (Corn Chex will work too)

recipes.title: Chocolate Coconut Chex Mix

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and Chenin Blanc are great choices for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 14 dollars.

productMatches.title: Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese
productMatches.description: Heinz Eifel Riesling Spatlese is made from late-harvestedRiesling grapes in the middle Mosel Valley of Germany. These grapes hang into late Autumn and ripen such that they produce a rich, full-bodied white wine. This is an elegant Riesling that offers a palate of different stone and tree fruit notes such as peach and apricot. It is luscious and full-bodied with a long and fresh finish.An ideal dinner Riesling and also can be enjoyed withriper, aged cheeses and spicy cuisine due to its enhancedcomplexity.Blend: 100% Riesling

recipes.instructions: 1. Pour the Chex cereal into a large bowl. Set aside. 2. In a medium microwavable bowl, melt the chocolate chips. Heat for 1 minute then stir. Heat for an additional 30 seconds and stir again. Continue with additional 30 seconds until completely melted and chocolate is smooth. Stir in the coconut extract. Pour the chocolate over the Chex cereal. Gently stir until cereal is well coated. Stir in the shredded coconut until the cereal is evenly coated. 3. Pour the cereal onto two large baking sheets. Sprinkle cereal with powdered sugar until well coated. Let the Chocolate Coconut Chex Mix sit until chocolate is dry, about 15 minutes. Serve and enjoy! Note-you can store the Chocolate Coconut Chex Mix in an air tight container for 3-4 days. It never lasts long in our house:)
